Martina Hellmann 72.30 m (1988) }} The 'discus throw' () is an event in track
and field athletics competition, in which an athlete throws a heavy discâcalled
a 'discus'âin an attempt to mark a farther distance than his or her competitors.
It is an ancient sport, as evidenced by the 5th century BC Myron statue,
[[Discobolus]]. Although not part of the modern pentathlon, it was one of the
events of the ancient pentathlon, which can be dated at least back to 708 BC. [http://www.olympic.org/uk/passion/collectors/object/gallery_uk.asp?ObjId=318
Notations on the 1920 discus stamps at the Olympic Museum]
categories: Athletic culture based on Greek antiquity
